Welcome to Contacts_web’s documentation!¶

Contacts_web main¶

async main.healthcheker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthcheker function is a simple endpoint that returns a welcome message. It also checks the database connection and raises an error if it fails.

Parameters:

db – AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.index()¶

The index function is the default function for this application. It returns a dictionary with a message key and value of &quot;Contact Application&quot;.

Returns:

A dictionary with the key &quot;message&quot; and value &quot;contact application&quot;

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent

classmethod validate_algorithm(v: any)¶

The validate_algorithm function is a custom validator that ensures the algorithm used to sign the JWT is either HS256 or HS512. The validate_algorithm function takes in one parameter, cls, which represents the class being validated. The second parameter, v, represents the value of algorithm being passed into our JWT payload.

Parameters:

  • cls – Pass the class that is being validated

  • v – any: Indicate that the value passed to the function can be of any type

Returns:

The value of the algorithm

Doc-author:

Trelent

class src.database.db.DBSessionManager(url: str)¶

Bases: object

The DBSessionManager class is a context manager that manages a database session.

Parameters:

url – str: Specify the URL of the database

session()¶

The session function is a context manager that yields a session object and closes it when the context is exited. If the session is not initialized, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

self – Represent the instance of the class

Returns:

A session object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function is a context manager that yields a session object and closes it when the context is exited. If the session is not initialized, it raises an exception. :return: A session object :doc-author: Trelent

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

async src.repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Get the user object from the database

Returns:

The deleted contact if it exists, otherwise none

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.find_contacts(query: str, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The find_contacts function takes in a query string, an async database session, and a user object. It then creates an SQLAlchemy statement that filters the Contact table by the query string. The function returns all contacts that match the filter.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for contacts

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contact objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: AsyncSession, user: User)¶

The get_contact function returns a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to get

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is only able to get contacts they have created

Returns:

The contact that matches the id and user

Doc-author:

Trelent

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and returns the user associated with that email.

If no user is found, it will return None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user to be searched for

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object if a user with the given email exists in the database, otherwise it returns none

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts_web AUTH ROUTES¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. Then, it checks if that user exists in our database, and if they do not exist, an error message is returned. If they do exist but their account has already been confirmed, another error message is returned. Otherwise (if they exist and their account has not yet been confirmed), we update their record in our database so that ‘confirm’ = True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed if the user has already confirmed their email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – AsyncSession: Get a database connection

Returns:

A dict with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.logout(user=Depends(get_current_user), db=Depends(get_db))¶

The logout function will logout the user by removing their refresh token from the database.

Parameters:

  • user – Get the current user

  • db – Access the database

:param : Get the current user from the database :return: A dictionary with the result :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token, refresh_token, and the type of bearer.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user from the database :return: A new access token and refresh token :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will confirm their account.

The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the user’s email address. It then checks if there is already a confirmed account associated with that email address, and returns an error message if so. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add tasks to the background task queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – AsyncSession: Pass the database connection to the function

:param : Get the user’s email address :return: A message to the user when they request an email :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶

The signup function creates a new user in the database. It takes an email, username and password as input. The function then checks if the email is already taken by another user. If it is, it returns a 409 Conflict error message to indicate that this account already exists.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the request

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

:param : Get the user id from the path :return: A userschema object :doc-author: Trelent

The find_contact function is used to find a contact in the database.

It takes a query string as an argument and returns all contacts that match the query.

Parameters:

  • query – str: Search for a contact by name

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database connection from the dependency injection

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents a contact

  • user – User: Get the user from the auth_service

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = Query(0), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Specify the number of contacts to return

  • ge – Specify the minimum value of a parameter

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned to 500

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip

  • ge – Specify a minimum value for the parameter

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

:param : Get the contact id from the url :return: A list of contacts :doc-author: Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.upconming_birthday(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The upconming_birthday function returns a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays.

The function takes in the database session and the current user as parameters. It then calls the upcoming_birthday method from rep_contacts to get a list of contacts with upcoming birthdays. If no contact is found, it raises an HTTPException 404 NOT FOUND error.

Parameters:

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have upcoming birthdays

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactUpdateSchema, contact_id: int = Path(PydanticUndefined), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of the contact to be updated, and a body containing all fields that are to be updated. If any field is not provided, it will not be changed in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactUpdateSchema: Pass the data from the request body to the function

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session

  • user – User: Check if the user is authenticated and has access to this route

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It uses the auth_service to get the current user, and then it returns that user object.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request

  • user – User: Get the current user

  • db – AsyncSession: Get the database session from the dependency injection

:param : Get the current user :return: The current user, :doc-author: Trelent

Contacts_web AUTH SERVICES¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a JWT token that is used to authenticate the user. The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. The data argument is a dictionary that contains information about the user, such as their username and password. The expires_delta argument specifies how long the access token will be valid for (in seconds). If no value is provided, the default value of 15 minutes will be used.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Store the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the time limit for a token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, username, password reset code (if applicable), and expiration date for the token.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token that is used to verify the user’s email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_telta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_telta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires. Defaults to None, which sets it to 7 days from now.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user information

  • expires_telta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_reset_password_token(email: str, token: str, data: dict)¶

The create_reset_password_token function creates a token that will be sent to the user’s email address. The token is created using the JWT library and contains information about when it was issued, when it expires, and what data should be used to reset the password.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user who is requesting a password reset

  • token – str: Pass in the token that was generated by the create_reset_password_token function

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s email and token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s email, a secret key and an algorithm

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an exception if the token is invalid or has expired.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested a refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the class itself

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – AsyncSession: Create a database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our secret key and algorithm, then returning the subject (sub) field of the payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

An email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses bcrypt to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that we want to hash

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed password.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method work for a specific instance of the class

  • plain_password – Compare the password that is entered by the user to a hashed version of it

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password stored in the database with the plain text password entered by a user

Returns:

A boolean value

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contacts_web EMAIL SERVICES¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link that they can click on to verify their email address. The function takes in three parameters:

-email: The user’s email address, which is used as the recipient of the message. -username: The username of the user, which is used in both the subject line and body of the message. This helps personalize it for them! -host: The hostname (or IP) where this service is running, so that we can construct a valid URL for them to click on.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username of the user to be verified

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
